triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: QMIX builds upon reinforcement learning to enable decentralized multi-agent coordination through centralized training.

triples.name: Q-learning
triples.relevance: QMIX extends value-based Q-learning methods to multi-agent settings by combining individual agent Q-values through a mixing network.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the core multi-agent system problem of coordinating decentralized agents while learning from centralized information.

triples.name: Deep learning
triples.relevance: QMIX uses deep neural networks to implement the mixing network that combines per-agent values into joint action-values.

triples.name: Neural network (machine learning)
triples.relevance: The mixing network is implemented as a neural network to learn the monotonic combination of per-agent values.

triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: QMIX applies deep learning techniques to reinforcement learning in multi-agent settings for end-to-end policy training.

triples.name: StarCraft (video game)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes the StarCraft Multi-Agent Challenge (SMAC) benchmark based on StarCraft for evaluating multi-agent RL algorithms.

triples.name: Decentralised system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the challenge of extracting decentralized policies from centralized training, a key requirement in decentralized systems.

triples.name: Monotonic function
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using monotonic functions to combine per-agent values, ensuring consistency between centralized and decentralized policies.

triples.name: List of datasets for machine-learning research
triples.relevance: The paper proposes the StarCraft Multi-Agent Challenge (SMAC) as a new benchmark dataset for evaluating multi-agent reinforcement learning algorithms.
